info.title: ACNH API
info.description:
A free Animal Crossing: New Horizons API for critters, furniture, villagers and more!

Contact me on Discord: Alexis#8717

The data can be obtained as an object array instead of a nested JSON by doing requests on https://acnhapi.com/v1a/ instead of https://acnhapi.com/v1/ <!-- ReDoc-Inject: <security-definitions> -->

# Authentication

<!-- ReDoc-Inject: <security-definitions> -->

parameters.name: fishID
parameters.description: Either the file-name of a fish or it's ID.

id.description: Number of the fish (as found in the critterpedia).

name.description: Name of the fish in different languages.

availability.description: When and where to find the fish.

month-northern.description: Month for the Northern hemisphere, empty if isAllYear is true.

month-southern.description: Month for the Southern hemisphere, empty if isAllYear is true.

time.description: Time of availability, empty is isAllDay is true.

isAllDay.description: Is the fish available at any hour?

isAllYear.description: Is the fish available at any day?

month-array-northern.description: Array containing the month when the critter is available in the Northern Hemisphere.

month-array-southern.description: Array containing the month when the critter is available in the Southern Hemisphere.

time-array.description: Array containing the hours when the critter is available during the day (24h format).

shadow.description: Size and/or shape of the shadow.

catch-phrase.description: Phrase (or often pun) when the fish is caught.

value.catch-phrase: I caught a bitterling! It's mad at me, but only a little.
value.museum-phrase: Bitterlings hide their eggs inside large bivalves—like clams—where the young can stay safe until grown. The bitterling isn't being sneaky. No, their young help keep the bivalve healthy by eating invading parasites! It's a wonderful bit of evolutionary deal making, don't you think? Each one keeping the other safe... Though eating parasites does not sound like a happy childhood... Is that why the fish is so bitter?

get.description:
Get fish data in JSON format. 

The {fishID} parameter is optional and can be removed to get all the fish data.

parameters.name: seaID
parameters.description: Either the file-name of a sea creature or it's ID.

id.description: Number of the sea creature (as found in the critterpedia).

name.description: Name of the sea creature in different languages.

availability.description: When to find the sea creature.

month-northern.description: Month for the Northern hemisphere, empty if isAllYear is true.

month-southern.description: Month for the Southern hemisphere, empty if isAllYear is true.

time.description: Time of availability, empty is isAllDay is true.

isAllDay.description: Is the sea creature available at any hour?

isAllYear.description: Is the sea creature available at any day?

month-array-northern.description: Array containing the month when the critter is available in the Northern Hemisphere.

month-array-southern.description: Array containing the month when the critter is available in the Southern Hemisphere.

time-array.description: Array containing the hours when the critter is available during the day (24h format).

catch-phrase.description: Catch phrase of the sea creature

value.catch-phrase: I got some seaweed! I couldn't kelp myself.
value.museum-phrase: Let it be known that seaweed is a misnomer of the highest order! That is, it is not a noxious weed so much as it is a marine algae most beneficial to life on land and sea. Seaweed, you see, provides essential habitat and food for all manner of marine creatures. And it creates a great deal of the oxygen we land lovers love to breath too, hoo! And yet, I can't help but shudder when the slimy stuff touches my toes during a swim. Hoot! The horror!

get.description:
Get sea creature data in JSON format. 

The {seaID} parameter is optional and can be removed to get all the sea creature data.

parameters.name: bugID
parameters.description: Either the file-name of a bug or it's ID.

name.description: Name of the bug in different languages.

availability.description: When and where to find the bug.

month-northern.description: Month for the Northern hemisphere, empty if isAllYear is true.

month-southern.description: Month for the Southern hemisphere, empty if isAllYear is true.

time.description: Time of availability, empty is isAllDay is true.

isAllDay.description: Is the bug available at any hour?

isAllYear.description: Is the bug available at any day?

month-array-northern.description: Array containing the month when the critter is available in the Northern Hemisphere.

month-array-southern.description: Array containing the month when the critter is available in the Southern Hemisphere.

time-array.description: Array containing the hours when the critter is available during the day (24h format).

catch-phrase.description: Phrase (or often pun) when the bug is caught.

value.catch-phrase: I caught a common butterfly! They often flutter by!
value.museum-phrase: The common butterfly would have you believe it is but a beautiful friend flitting prettily about the flowers. Bah, I say! They may seem innocent things with their pretty white wings, but they hide a dark side! The common butterfly caterpillar is called a cabbage worm, you see, and it's a most voracious pest. The ravenous beasts chew through cabbage, broccoli, kale and the like with a devastating gusto. And my feathers! Their green coloring is truly GROSS! A hoo-rrific hue, I say.

get.description:
Get bugs data in JSON format. 

The {bugID} parameter is optional and can be removed to get all the bugs data.

name.description: Name of the fossil in different languages.

value.museum-phrase: Amber is formed from the sap of ancient trees that hardened over time. Because of its beauty, it has often been traded and used as jewelry throughout history. However, individual specimens may contain ancient plants or insects trapped inside them! These are valuable resources for learning about ancient eras, such as when the dinosaurs roamed... And this is why they are sometimes displayed in certain...ahem... exceptional museums! Like mine.

get.description:
Get fossil data in JSON format. 

The {fossilName} parameter is optional and can be removed to get all the fossils data.

parameters.name: villagerID
parameters.description: Either the file-name of a villager or it's ID.

name.description: Name of the villager in different languages.

birthday.description: Birthday of the villager in Day/Month format.

gender.description: Gender of the villager, either "Male" or "Female".

catch-phrase.description: The catch phrase of a villager.

get.description:
Get villager data in JSON format. 

The {villagerID} parameter is optional and can be removed to get all the villagers data.

parameters.name: fishID
parameters.description: Either the file-name of a fish or it's ID.

get.description:
Get fish icons in PNG format. 

The {fishID} parameter can be found using the /v1/fish/ endpoint.

parameters.name: bugID
parameters.description: Either the file-name of a bug or it's ID.

get.description:
Get bugs icons in PNG format. 

The {bugID} parameter can be found using the /v1/bugs/ endpoint.

parameters.name: villagerID
parameters.description: Either the file-name of a villager or it's ID.

get.description:
Get villager icons in PNG format. 

The {villagerID} parameter can be found using the /v1/villagers/ endpoint.

parameters.name: fishID
parameters.description: Either the file-name of a fish or it's ID.

get.description:
Get fish images in PNG format. 

The {fishID} parameter can be found using the /v1/fish/ endpoint.

parameters.name: bugID
parameters.description: Either the file-name of a bug or it's ID.

get.description:
Get bugs images in PNG format. 

The {bugID} parameter can be found using the /v1/bugs/ endpoint.

parameters.name: villagerID
parameters.description: Either the file-name of a villager or it's ID.

get.description:
Get villager images in PNG format. 

The {villagerID} parameter can be found using the /v1/villagers/ endpoint.

Get fossil images in PNG format. 

The {fossilName} parameter can be found using the /v1/fossils/ endpoint.

file-name.description: String to access the MP3 and the song cover files.

buy-price.description: Price at which the song is sold, is null if the song can't be purchased

isOrderable.description: Can the song be ordered from the catalogue?

get.description:
Get K.K. songs data in JSON format. 

The {songID} parameter is optional and can be removed to get all the songs data.

Get song cover images in PNG format. 

The {songID} parameter can be found using the /v1/songs/ endpoint.

Get K.K. songs data in MP3 format. 

The {songID} parameter can be found using the /songs/ endpoint.

name.description: Name of the art in different languages.

buy-price.description: Price at which Redd sells the art

sell-price.description: Price it which the art will sell (if genuine)

name.name-JPja: アカデミックなめいが

value.museum-desc: This drawing is based on the "ideal" human-body ratio, as stated in "De architectura." "De architectura" was a treatise by Vitruvius, an architect from the early 1st century BCE.

get.description:
Get art data in JSON format. 

The {artID} parameter is optional and can be removed to get all the art data.

Get art icons in PNG format. 

The {artID} parameter can be found using the /art/ endpoint.

Get hourly songs data in MP3 format. 

The {songID} parameter can be found using the /backgroundmusic/ endpoint.

hour.description: Hour in 24h format at which the song plays

get.description:
Get hourly songs data in JSON format. 

The {songID} parameter is optional and can be removed to get all the songs data.

schema.description: Returns an array of variant for the furniture specified as housewareID

variant.description: Name of the variant, null if the furniture only has one.

kit-cost.description: Number of kit required to customize, null if can't be customized

miles-price.description: Number of miles to purchase the item at the Nook Stop

source.description: Where to get the item from, separated by a ";" if there are multiple sources.

version.description: Version of the game the item was introduced in.

hha-set.description: HHA set the item is in

isInteractive.description: Can you interact with the item?

isOutdoor.description: Can the item be placed outdoors?

speaker-type.description: Type of speaker, null if not a speaker

lighting-type.description: Type of lighting, null if not a light source

isCatalog.description: Can the item be ordered from the catalog?

file-name.description: Name of the file for the image endpoint

variant-id.description: ID of the variant, null if the item doesnt have variants.

internal-id.description: Internal ID of the objects (in the game)

buy-price.description: Price at which the item is purchased

sell-price.description: Price at which the item is sold

value.source-detail: Available in Nook's Cranny (upgraded only), in the unique furniture slot

get.description:
Get houseware data in JSON format. 

The {housewareID} parameter is optional and can be removed to get all the housewareID data.
see /v1/houseware endpoint.

Get furniture images in PNG format. 

The {furnitureFileName} parameter can be found using the file-name key in an houseware/wallmounted/misc variant object (eg: FtrJewelrystand_Remake_0_0).
